page.title: 02Compton House.Nr.Yeovil.
page.content: Two interesting features of{tourism in the area are{the butterfly and silk {farms in the grounds of Compton House. At the{Butterfly farm}there are about 500 different species of butterfly. They come from all over the world from countries such as Maleus,Tanzania and Peru. The biggest is Axelanduei. The smallest is Cupido. They also keep peacocks and silk worms. There are 4 permanent staff dealing with nearly 100,000 visitors in a year. The butterflies are kept in natural surroundings and feed on some exotic plants. Silk is produced at the{silk {farm}from cocoons spun by silk worms. Each year about 90,000 cocoons are used to produce silk which is then sent to clothing manufacturers. The silk worms need little food so they are easy to keep.
